dogNLabel.notes: Low Dose - Cardiovascular resuscitation - Early in CPR - Note: Veterinarians are highly encouraged to obtain the RECOVER evidence and knowledge gap analysis on veterinary CPR.  Download for free at veccs.org

catNLabel.notes: Low Dose - Cardiovascular resuscitation - Early in CPR - Note: Veterinarians are highly encouraged to obtain the RECOVER evidence and knowledge gap analysis on veterinary CPR.  Download for free at veccs.org

dogNLabel.notes: High Dose - Cardiovascular resuscitation - Note: Veterinarians are highly encouraged to obtain the RECOVER evidence and knowledge gap analysis on veterinary CPR.  Download for free at veccs.org

catNLabel.notes: High Dose - Cardiovascular resuscitation - Note: Veterinarians are highly encouraged to obtain the RECOVER evidence and knowledge gap analysis on veterinary CPR.  Download for free at veccs.org

dogNLabel.notes: During cardiopulmonary cerebral resuscitation (CPCR) efforts for adjunctive treatment of bradycardias, incomplete AV block, etc.

catNLabel.notes: During cardiopulmonary cerebral resuscitation (CPCR) efforts for adjunctive treatment of bradycardias, incomplete AV block, etc.

dogLabel.notes: Antidysrhythmic agent - Refractory ventricular fibrillation (VF) pulseless ventricular tachycardia (VT) Ventricular tachycardia - For rapid conversion of life-threatening, sustained, and/or unstable ventricular tachycardia.  A consensus does not exist for a dosing protocol but an initial dosage of 2-4 mg/kg IV over 1-2 minutes while monitoring ECG may be considered.  See official documentation for more labeled and off labeled uses

catLabel.notes: Antiarrhythmic: Initially IV bolus of 0.25 - 0.5 mg/kg given slowly.  Can be repeated at 0.15 - 0.25 mg/kg in 5-20 minutes.  See official documentation for instruction and further use.

dogLabel.notes: Anti-inflammatory; glucocorticoid agent - 0.25 - 1.25 mg (total dose) PO tablets daily  in single or two divided doses.

catLabel.notes: Anti-inflammatory; glucocorticoid agent - 0.125 - 0.5 mg (total dose) PO tablets daily  in single or two divided doses.

dogNLabel.notes: Hyperphosphatemia associated with chronic kidney disease using a low-phosphorus diet. Other uses in official docs.

catNLabel.notes: Hyperphosphatemia associated with chronic kidney disease using a low-phosphorus diet. Other uses in official docs.

dogNLabel.notes: Adjunctive treatment during CPCR - From the RECOVER guidelines - Use of vasopressin as a substitute or in combination with epinephrine every 3-5 min may be considered.

catNLabel.notes: Adjunctive treatment during CPCR - From the RECOVER guidelines - Use of vasopressin as a substitute or in combination with epinephrine every 3-5 min may be considered.
